description: Full pipeline — all inputs provided including GS data. Tests complete assembly into .docx with exhibit index.
prompt:
Assemble my NIW petition. Here are all my inputs:

EVALUATE JSON:
{"applicant":{"name":"Dr. Amara Osei","pronoun":"she/her","degree":"PhD","field":"Epidemiology","university":"Johns Hopkins","year_degree":"2019","years_experience":5,"current_title":"Research Scientist","current_employer":"CDC contractor"},"pathway":"A","verdict":"QUALIFIED","academic_metrics":{"publication_count":6,"first_authored":3,"citation_count":89,"h_index":6,"peer_review_count":11}}

ENDEAVOR: Dr. Osei proposes to advance national pandemic surveillance by developing and deploying ML-based wastewater epidemiology tools for early outbreak detection across U.S. public health systems. [Full endeavor statement + 3 pillar titles provided]

PILLAR 1 PROSE: [Full Section 1-5 prose for Pillar 1 — Wastewater ML Methodology]
PILLAR 2 PROSE: [Full Section 1-5 prose for Pillar 2 — State Health System Integration]
PILLAR 3 PROSE: [Full Section 1-5 prose for Pillar 3 — Federal Policy Translation]

GS JSON: {"total_citations":89,"h_index":6,"i10_index":4,"papers":[{"title":"ML-based wastewater surveillance","venue":"Emerging Infectious Diseases","year":2022,"citation_count":34,"is_first_authored":true,"indexed_in":["PubMed","Scopus"]}]}

GS CSV: title,venue,year,citation_count,is_first_authored
ML-based wastewater surveillance,Emerging Infectious Diseases,2022,34,true
expected_output: Complete .docx file with all 9 sections, publications table with PubMed/Scopus-indexed papers, exhibit index with sequential numbering, Dhanasar citation in prayer for relief.
assertions: All 9 sections present in correct order
Publications table present with venue and citation columns
Exhibit index table present with sequential numbering
Prayer for Relief cites Dhanasar 26 I&N Dec. 884
Unified Prong 3 does not copy pillar Prong 3 prose verbatim
No [GS_DATA_NEEDED] placeholders — GS data was provided
No hedging language (no 'may', 'might', 'could potentially') in generated sections

description: GS data missing — tests placeholder mode. All other inputs provided. Skill should assemble with [GS_DATA_NEEDED] tags rather than blocking.
prompt:
Assemble my NIW petition. I have everything except Google Scholar data — can you build it with placeholders for now?

EVALUATE JSON: {"applicant":{"name":"Dr. Ravi Mehta","pronoun":"he/him","degree":"PhD","field":"Computer Science","university":"CMU","year_degree":"2020","current_title":"Research Engineer","current_employer":"DARPA contractor"},"pathway":"A","verdict":"QUALIFIED","academic_metrics":{"publication_count":8,"first_authored":4,"citation_count":112,"h_index":7}}

ENDEAVOR + PILLARS: [provided]
PILLAR 1-3 PROSE: [provided]
GS DATA: NOT PROVIDED
expected_output: Complete .docx with [GS_DATA_NEEDED: total_citations] and [GS_DATA_NEEDED: publications_table] placeholders in Section III. All other 8 sections fully assembled. Skill does not block or refuse.
assertions: docx file generated despite missing GS data
Section III contains [GS_DATA_NEEDED] placeholders clearly labeled
Sections I, II, IV-IX fully populated
Post-assembly check flags GS placeholders as items to complete before filing
Skill does not ask user to provide GS data before proceeding

description: Pattern D trigger — GS data includes a paper in an unverified journal. Tests that skill flags it rather than silently including it.
prompt:
Assemble my petition. GS data includes one paper in a journal I'm not sure is indexed.

GS JSON partial: {"papers":[{"title":"Analysis of drug interactions","venue":"International Journal of Advanced Research","year":2021,"citation_count":8,"is_first_authored":true,"indexed_in":[]}]}
expected_output: Credentials section includes the paper but with an inline [NOTE: 'International Journal of Advanced Research' — indexing status unconfirmed...] flag. Paper is not silently omitted or silently included without the warning.
assertions: Inline NOTE flag present for unverified journal
NOTE instructs petitioner to verify against ISI/Scopus/PubMed before filing
Skill does not refuse to include the paper — it flags and continues
